metadata.title: CVE-2014-7928 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
hydrogen.cc in Google V8, as used Google Chrome before 40.0.2214.91, doesnot properly handle arrays with holes, which allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (memory corruption) or possibly have unspecifiedother impact via crafted JavaScript code that triggers an array copy.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7928` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-browser-l10n - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-chromedriver - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.4.2-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.4.2-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.4.2-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.4.2-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.4.2-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.4.2-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120').
oxide-qt package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.2-0ubuntu1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
